item.title: Ice Giants
item.description: This theme will use existing ground- and space-based observations of the ice giants to prepare for observations with the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), where guaranteed time observations of both worlds (programme IDs 1248 and 1249) have been awarded and prepared by Dr. Fletcher. Ms. Naomi Rowe-Gurney arrived in Leicester in September 2017 to begin a PhD thesis mining the archive of Spitzer observations of both Uranus and Neptune (disc-averaged due to the small angular size of these planets).

item.title: Jupiter's Climate Variability
item.description: Recent publications have explored the moist convective plumes responsible for the revival of Jupiter’s South Equatorial Belt in 2009-2011 (http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.icarus.2017.01.001), the 3-5 year cycle of expansion activity within Jupiter’s North Equatorial Belt (http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/2017GL073383), and a review of cyclic activity across all of Jupiter’s main belts (http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/2017GL073806). Dr. Arrate Antunano-Martin arrived in Leicester in October 2017 and is working with an infrared dataset spanning more than three jovian years (1983-2018) to identify periodicities and their underlying causes in the jovian atmosphere.
